qas.question: How did Gaddafi view Libya when he returned from England?

answers.text: he returned home "more confident and proud of our values, ideals and social character."

qas.question: How did the Bovington signal course director view Gaddafi?

answers.text: he thought him an "amusing officer, always cheerful, hard-working, and conscientious."

qas.question: How did Gaddafi feel about the British officers?

answers.text: claiming British Army officers racially insulted him

qas.question: When Gaddafi traveled to London, did he attempt to blend into the English culture?

answers.text: finding it difficult adjusting to the country's culture; asserting his Arab identity in London, he walked around Piccadilly wearing traditional Libyan robes

qas.question: How did Gaddafi feel about the British Army officers?

qas.question: When Gaddafi went to England, how did he respond to their culture?

answers.text: finding it difficult adjusting to the country's culture; asserting his Arab identity in London, he walked around Piccadilly wearing traditional Libyan robes

qas.question: When Gaddafi returned to Libya, how did he view his country?

answers.text: while he travelled to England believing it more advanced than Libya, he returned home "more confident and proud of our values, ideals and social character."
